edu.bath.transitivityutils
Interface TransitiveRelation<E>

All Superinterfaces:
Relation<E>
All Known Subinterfaces:
TransitiveBiRelation<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ForwardingTransitiveBiRelation, ForwardingTransitiveRelation
public interface TransitiveRelation<E>
extends Relation<E>

A transitive binary relation. In other words, instances of this type guarantee that, for any A, B and C objects that areRelated(A, B) == true and areRelated(B, C) == true, then areRelated(A, C) is also true.

The relationships that were explicitly recorded through relate(Object, Object) (and not merely induced by transitivity) are represented by the direct() navigator.

See Also:
Relations

Methods inherited from interface edu.bath.transitivityutils.Relation
areRelated
 

Method Detail

direct

Navigator<E> direct()
Returns the navigator that represents the explicit part of this transitive relation. That is, the relationships that were created directly through relate(Object, Object), and not merely induced by transitivity.

relate

void relate(E subject,
            E object)
Relates a subject with an object (optional operation). After successfully invoking this operation, areRelated(subject, object) must return true. Note that relating an object with an equal does nothing, since reflexivity is implicit. As a consequence, the direct() navigator does not obtain a new relationship after such a call, .

Specified by:
relate in interface Relation<E>
